title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 01 November 2016 - XWiki

16:41 <msmeria> has quit  
17:20 <martinus\_\_> has quit  
18:27 <zizz> has joined #xwiki  
18:28 <zizz> hi folks  
18:28 <zizz> I have just installed my first XWiki instance, added some plugins and started to create pages  
18:29 <zizz> now, whenever I save a page I get http://pastebin.com/LGGsc6Pb appended  
18:29 <zizz> Have you seen anything like this before? I'm guessing it could be one of the plugins I installed?  
18:34 <mflorea> has quit  
18:57 <ClemensR> zizz:  looks like some extension is broken  
18:58 <ClemensR> data-gramm\_id  ... hmm  
18:58 <ClemensR> is this from viewing the page in the wiki editor ?  
19:00 <zizz> ClemensR: I'm editing it in the editor and when I save I can see it. If then I edit it again in "source" mode I can remove it, preview and save without the code  
19:00 <ClemensR> ah, you work completely inside the WYSIWYG-Editor  
19:01 <ClemensR> are there any macros on the page?  or does it happen on every page?  
19:01 <zizz> I'm starting off with a blank page  
19:01 <ClemensR> ah, I guess if you go in source mode, remove it, then go back in normal mode, it comes back again?  
19:01 <ClemensR> normal edit mode, I mean  
19:02 <zizz> let me try  
19:04 <systemd> has joined #xwiki  
19:07 <zizz> ClemensR: it comes back if I make any changes after getting back to WYSIWYG mode not before  
19:07 <ClemensR> oh, ok, only if you change something .... this stats to look strange  
19:09 <zizz> I guess it would be useful to state that one of the extensions I installed was Visual Realtime Collaborative Editor  
19:10 <ClemensR> which xwiki version is it, actually, and which browser are you using?  
19:11 <zizz> XWiki 8.3 and Chrome latest stable  
19:12 <ClemensR> ok, I see some mentioning of the "mceContentBody"  in the javascript code, wondering where that comes from  
19:12 <ClemensR> mce was retired quite some time ago  
19:13 <ClemensR> I mean the use of it within XWiki  
19:15 <zizz> I see, can I help somehow?  
19:16 <ClemensR> hm, can you check if the problem goes away if you uninstall that realtime collaborative editor, or some other extension?  
19:16 <ClemensR> still looks curious, like if some javascript went mad  
19:17 <ClemensR> unfortunately it is getting late here in my timezone, so I gotta go soon  
19:20 <zizz> I'll uninstall that one and seee  
19:22 <ClemensR> I just checked if that javascript is in some XWiki core code or one of the common extensions, but nope  
19:23 <zizz> ClemensR: it didn't go away with the realtime editor  
19:23 <ClemensR> hm, this extension also needs some UI to get "imported"  
19:23 <ClemensR> the one via  ./do --post Admin:[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection):8080/xwiki  
19:24 <ClemensR> not sure if that is still lingerign around and runining  your installation  
19:24 <ClemensR> but, anyway, this editor does not contain a snippet that looks the the one which get inserted in the editor  
19:25 <ClemensR> maybe one of the extension is a custom layout / skin ?  
19:25 <zizz> is there a way to export a list of instaled extensions?  
19:29 <ClemensR> actually there is a section in the admin labeled "installed extensions", but I guess this also lists the "build in extensions"  that are already pre-installed, so it might not be exactly useful in your case  
19:30 <zizz> I know I'm looking at it right now  
19:31 <zizz> "javax.inject" this looks suspicious  
19:31 <zizz> installed as dependency apparentyl  
19:32 <zizz> or not, seems it's for java not js  
19:32 <ClemensR> if you have an data/extension/repository in your "permanent" dir, you can check that for stuff not starting with org%2Exwiki%2Eplatform  
19:32 <ClemensR> yup, the javax.inject is a library needed for internal programming stuff  
19:33 <ClemensR> these should be the directories storing code which has been installed as UI-components and extensions  
19:33 <ClemensR> unfortunately the bundles ones, too, but at least without the gazillion java compontents  
19:34 <ClemensR> s/bundles/bundled/  
19:34 <ClemensR> darn, it is really too late here, I gotta run  
19:34 <zizz> ok, thanks for help anyway  
19:35 <ClemensR> hope you find the source of the problem, otherwise see you tomorrow  
19:35 <zizz> sure, take care  
19:35 <ClemensR> has quit  
20:36 <daemoen> is now known as <ww3election2016>  
20:37 <ww3election2016> is now known as <Daemoen>
